title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't supporting the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, despite his long history with the team.
Brady later expressed support for the Patriots and owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, urging them to win a 7th ring.
Brady faced backlash for his comments, with former teammates criticizing his lack of public support for the Patriots.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Matthew Stafford won the NFL MVP narrowly, beating Drake Maye by six points amid ongoing debate.
Jeff Saturday believes Patriots QB Drake Maye should've won MVP for his dual-threat capabilities and stellar performance.
With different opinions, ESPN's Mina Kimes voted for Maye citing superior statistics; Dan Orlovsky supported Stafford.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Sam Darnold's performance against the Patriots' blitz-heavy defense could be key in determining the Super Bowl LX winner.
Patriots' leading tackler Robert Spillane's ankle injury may impact New England's ability to stop Seattle's run game.
Seattle's strong defensive pressure will test New England's rookie offensive linemen Will Campbell and Jared Wilson.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye has no injury designation and is set to play in Sunday's Super Bowl.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are listed as questionable for the Patriots with knee and ankle injuries.
Patriots rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is questionable, but participated fully in practices this week.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster is streaming on Netflix.
'Splitsville', a 2025 comedy with Kyle Marvin and Dakota Johnson, is available on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, with NBC airing tape-delayed coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' has become a rallying cry for the New England Patriots.
The phrase originated during a pregame speech by Diggs before a key game against the Buffalo Bills in Week 5.
Diggs faces assault charges but remains a team leader as the Patriots prepare for Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, from North Attleboro, is running her first marathon in the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Demeris is raising funds for Massachusetts General Hospital's Emergency Response, Cancer Care, and Home Base Program.
Her fundraising motivations are influenced by personal connections to emergency services, cancer research, and support for veterans.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets South End location to close in June after 28 years due to costly building updates.
Community petition with 1,500 signatures opposes conversion of Foodie's space to non-retail use by Croft School.
Croft School withdraws expansion plans at 1421 Washington Street after neighborhood protests over loss of grocery store.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The Instagram account @DrakeMayeLover has amassed nearly 400,000 followers since its creation in May 2024.
The account expresses strong support for Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, who acknowledged its humorous content in a video.
The anonymous owner plans to reveal their identity after meeting Maye and getting a photo with him.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality about the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup, causing mixed reactions among New England Patriots fans.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers voiced opinions, showing a split between disappointment, understanding, and indifference regarding Brady's stance.
Brady's impartiality stems from his current role as a broadcaster and part-owner of the Las Vegas Raiders.
